translated: The Chapter on the Conditions🔽The Triad-Couplet-Conditioned Arising Discourse

original: Dhammānulomapaccanīya (3), Tikadukapaṭṭhānapāḷi (4)🔽16.36. Parittattika, Hetuduka🔽Parittaṁ hetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca namahaggato nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā terasa, ārammaṇe nava …pe… aññamaññe ekādasa …pe… avigate terasa.
analyzed: dhamma anuloma paccanīya tika duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi  parittattika hetuduka  parittam hetum dhammam paṭicca na mahaggataḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā terasa ārammaṇe nava pe aññamaññe ekādasa pe avigate terasa
translated: The Limited and the Cause🔽With a limited cause as condition there arises a non-limited non-cause dhammas. (In brief) … With a cause as condition, there are thirteen. With an object as condition, there are nine. … With a pre-arising as condition, there are eleven. … With the unincluded as condition, there are thirteen.

original: Parittaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naparitto nanahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā cuddasa, ārammaṇe cuddasa, adhipatiyā nava …pe… avigate cuddasa.
analyzed: parittam na hetum dhammam paṭicca na parittaḥ na na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā cuddasa ārammaṇe cuddasa adhipatiyā nava pe avigate cuddasa
translated: With a limited non-cause as condition there arises a non-limited non-cause dhammas. (In brief) … With a cause as condition, there are fourteen. With an object as condition, there are fourteen. With predominance as condition, there are nine. … With the unincluded as condition, there are fourteen.
